When I would have healed Israel, then the iniquity of Ephraim was discovered, and the wickedness of Samaria: for they commit falsehood; and the thief cometh in, <FI>and<Fi> the troop of robbers spoileth without.<RF>wickedness: Heb. evils<Rf><RF>spoileth: Heb. strippeth<Rf>
And they consider not in their hearts <FI>that<Fi> I remember all their wickedness: now their own doings have beset them about; they are before my face.<RF>consider…: Heb. say not to<Rf>
They make the king glad with their wickedness, and the princes with their lies.

They <FI>are<Fi> all adulterers, as an oven heated by the baker, <FI>who<Fi> ceaseth from raising after he hath kneaded the dough, until it be leavened.<RF>who…: or, the raiser will cease<Rf><RF>raising: or, waking<Rf>
In the day of our king the princes have made <FI>him<Fi> sick with bottles of wine; he stretched out his hand with scorners.<RF>bottles…: or, heat through wine<Rf>
For they have made ready their heart like an oven, whiles they lie in wait: their baker sleepeth all the night; in the morning it burneth as a flaming fire.<RF>made…: or, applied<Rf>
They are all hot as an oven, and have devoured their judges; all their kings are fallen: <FI>there is<Fi> none among them that calleth unto me.<CM>
Ephraim, he hath mixed himself among the people; Ephraim is a cake not turned.
Strangers have devoured his strength, and he knoweth <FI>it<Fi> not: yea, gray hairs are here and there upon him, yet he knoweth not.<RF>here…: Heb. sprinkled<Rf>
And the pride of Israel testifieth to his face: and they do not return to the LORD their God, nor seek him for all this.
Ephraim also is like a silly dove without heart: they call to Egypt, they go to Assyria.
When they shall go, I will spread my net upon them; I will bring them down as the fowls of the heaven; I will chastise them, as their congregation hath heard.

Woe unto them! for they have fled from me: destruction unto them! because they have transgressed against me: though I have redeemed them, yet they have spoken lies against me.<RF>destruction: Heb. spoil<Rf>
And they have not cried unto me with their heart, when they howled upon their beds: they assemble themselves for corn and wine, <FI>and<Fi> they rebel against me.
Though I have bound <FI>and<Fi> strengthened their arms, yet do they imagine mischief against me.<RF>have…: or, chastened<Rf>

They return, <FI>but<Fi> not to the most High: they are like a deceitful bow: their princes shall fall by the sword for the rage of their tongue: this <FI>shall be<Fi> their derision in the land of Egypt.<CM>
